intro: Canthium pervilleanum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. Canthium pervilleanum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
